definitions.definition: To lay or place; to put (one thing to another)
definitions.example: to apply cream to a rash

definitions.definition: To put to use; to use or employ for a particular purpose, or in a particular case
definitions.example: to apply funds to the repayment of a debt

definitions.definition: To make use of, declare, or pronounce, as suitable, fitting, or relative
definitions.example: We need to apply the skills we've learned to solve this problem

definitions.definition: To put closely; to join; to engage and employ diligently, or with attention
To to address; to refer; generally used reflexively.
To submit oneself as a candidate (with the adposition "to" designating the recipient of the submission, and the adposition "for" designating the position).
definitions.example: I recently applied to the tavern for a job as a bartender.

definitions.definition: To pertain or be relevant to a specified individual or group.
definitions.example: That rule only applies to foreigners.

definitions.definition: To busy; to keep at work; to ply.
